intro: Jasione montana var. major, commonly known as the greater mountain jasione, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in dense, terminal clusters. The leaves are linear to lanceolate, often with a hairy surface, and are typically arranged alternately along the stem. This perennial herb is native to central and southern Europe, where it thrives in rocky or gravelly soils. It is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, preferring full sun to partial shade.
